Resizing an engagement ring can be a bit of a process, but a good jeweler can make it look like it was made for you. As for your grandmother's diamond necklace, that's wonderful that it fits you perfectly! It's always special to wear a family heirloom that holds sentimental value.

For resizing your engagement ring, I would recommend following the same steps I mentioned earlier to find a good jeweler. You can also ask your friends, family, or coworkers who have had similar work done for recommendations. Additionally, you can check with local jewelry stores or boutiques that specialize in custom jewelry work or jewelry repair.

When searching for a jeweler to resize your ring, make sure to ask the right questions, such as:

* What is their experience with resizing engagement rings?
* What is their process for resizing, and what materials do they use?
* Do they offer a warranty or guarantee on their work?
* Can they provide before-and-after photos or examples of previous resizing work?
* What is their turnaround time, and can they meet your deadline if you need the ring resized quickly?

Some popular online jewelers that offer resizing services include:

* James Allen: They offer a free resizing service within 60 days of purchase, and they have a team of expert jewelers who can resize your ring.
* Blue Nile: They offer a resizing service, and their team of jewelers can work with you to ensure a perfect fit.
* Local Jewelers: Don't forget to check with local jewelers in your area, as they may offer custom resizing services and can work with you one-on-one to get the perfect fit.

As for your grandmother's diamond necklace, it's wonderful that it fits you perfectly! If you're considering having it appraised or cleaned, you may want to consider a jeweler who specializes in estate jewelry or antique pieces. They can help you determine the value of the necklace and provide guidance on how to care for it.

Remember to always do your research, read reviews, and ask plenty of questions before entrusting your jewelry to a jeweler. Good luck, and I hope you find a great jeweler to work with!
